intro: Cyanea knudsenii, commonly known as the Kauai sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are broad and waxy, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blossoms. Cyanea knudsenii is also known for its ecological importance, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
